description: personal study ID composed by the first authors’ first surname_year of publication_first title word
age presented in years – see metadata for source of age
species of individuals participating in the study -bonobo/chimpanzee/gorilla/orangutan
set of trials - mostly occurring on the same day - usually numerical
presentation of the experiment to the participants - usually numerical
continuous count of the presentation of the experiment to the participants

study conditions: visual/ audition/ or control. In visual apes observe the content of the cups/ in audition apes hear the rattling noise if the cup contains a reward/ in control apes do not know where the food is baited
signals whether the food reward is underneath the left cup
signals whether the food reward is underneath the right cup
signals which cup the participant chose. 1 means left and 2 means right
signals the meaning of the choice code
signals whether the participant found the food and succeeded (1) or did not find the food and failed (0)
